xxl.core.spatial.cursors

Class Replicator

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.cursors.AbstractCursor<E>
      • xxl.core.cursors.wrappers.IteratorCursor
        • xxl.core.spatial.cursors.Replicator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterator, Cursor

    public class Replicator
extends IteratorCursor
    The Replicator provides the replication engine of GESS. The Replicator maps each input-Object (of arbitrary type) to an Iterator of KPEzCode-Objects. For a detailed description see "GESS: a Scalable Similarity-Join Algorithm for Mining Large Data Sets in High Dimensional Spaces by Jens-Peter Dittrich and Bernhard Seeger, ACM SIGKDD 2001. pages: 47-56."
    See Also:
    GESS, GESS.ReferencePointMethod, FixedPoint, FixedPointRectangle, KPEzCode

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Replicator.MaxGeneration
      Allows at most bound generations (2^(generation) replicates are created).
      static class  Replicator.MaxReplicates
      Constrains replication to 'bound' replicates per input-element.
      static class  Replicator.MaxSplitBit
      Allows splits if the actual bitIndex is greater or equal than a given bound.
      static class  Replicator.MaxSplitLevel
      Allows splits if the level is smaller or equal than a given bitIndex.
      static class  Replicator.MaxSplitsPerLevel
      Allows at most bound splits per level.
      protected static class  Replicator.QueueEl
      A Wrapper-class needed to unwind the recursive split.
      static class  Replicator.Split
      Abstract Predicate used to decide whether further splits are allowed.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static long[] bit
      table used to select the bit at position 'index'
      static long EL_IN
      Counter used to count elements that are passed to the replicator (that are passed "in" to this operator)
      static long EL_OUT
      Counter used to count elements that are created by the replicator (that are passed "out" to the next operator)
      static long[] m1
      table used to set all bits > bitIndex = split-bit to true
      static long[] prefix
      table used to select the bit-prefix, i.e. all bits <= bitIndex = split-bit
      static Replicator.Split SPLIT_ONCE
      split until sons
      static Replicator.Split SPLIT_ONCE_PER_LEVEL
      split once per level
      static Replicator.Split SPLIT_THRICE
      split until grandgrandsons
      static Replicator.Split SPLIT_THRICE_PER_LEVEL
      split thrice per level
      static Replicator.Split SPLIT_TWICE
      split until grandsons
      static Replicator.Split SPLIT_TWICE_PER_LEVEL
      split twice per level

    • Constructor Detail

      • Replicator

        public Replicator(Function inputMapping,
                  Iterator input,
                  Function newResult,
                  int dimensions,
                  Queue queue,
                  Predicate splitAllowed,
                  int minBitIndex)
        The top-level constructor for this class.
        Parameters:
        inputMapping - Mapper for the input to the Replicator (maps incoming object of arbitrary type to FixedPointRectangle)
        input - the input to be processed by this class
        newResult - a Function that maps the internally used QueueEl to the Object to be returned by the replication process
        dimensions - the dimensionality of the data
        queue - the queue used to process replicates
        splitAllowed - the Predicate used to determine whether a split is allowed
        minBitIndex - the minimal bit-index to be considered for the replication-process ( 0 <= bitIndex <= 62 )

      • Replicator

        public Replicator(Function inputMapping,
                  Iterator input,
                  Function newResult,
                  int dimensions,
                  Predicate splitAllowed,
                  int minBitIndex)
        Creates a new Replicator. This constructors passes a ListQueue to the parameter 'queue' of the top-level constructor.
        Parameters:
        inputMapping - Mapper for the input to the Replicator (maps incoming object of arbitrary type to FixedPointRectangle)
        input - the input to be processed by this class
        newResult - a Function that maps the internally used QueueEl to the Object to be returned by the replication process
        dimensions - the dimensionality of the data
        splitAllowed - the Predicate used to determine whether a split is allowed
        minBitIndex - the minimal bit-index to be considered for the replication-process ( 0 <= bitIndex <= 62 )
        See Also:
        ListQueue

      • Replicator

        public Replicator(Function inputMapping,
                  Iterator input,
                  int dimensions,
                  Predicate splitAllowed,
                  int minBitIndex,
                  boolean considerAdditionalBits)
        Creates a new Replicator. This constructors provides an implementation of the parameter-Function 'newResult'.
        Parameters:
        inputMapping - Mapper for the input to the Replicator (maps incoming object of arbitrary type to FixedPointRectangle)
        input - the input to be processed by this class
        dimensions - the dimensionality of the data
        splitAllowed - the Predicate used to determine whether a split is allowed
        minBitIndex - the minimal bit-index to be considered for the replication-process ( 0 <= bitIndex <= 62 )
        considerAdditionalBits - determines whether kd-splitting should be applied (otherwise quadtree-splitting is performed)

      • Replicator

        public Replicator(Function inputMapping,
